desc2.pins3: RXD0 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 0

desc3.pins3: TXD0 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 0

desc4.pins2: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc5.pins2: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.
desc5.pins3: OC3A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC3A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc6.pins2: INT4 - External Interrupt source 4 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc6.pins3: OC3B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC3B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc7.pins2: INT5 - External Interrupt source 5 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc7.pins3: OC3C - Output compare matchC output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC3C pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc8.pins2: INT6 - External Interrupt source 6 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc8.pins3: T3 - Timer/Counter3 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc9.pins2: INT7 - External Interrupt source 7 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc9.pins3: ICP3 - Timer/Counter3 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter3 description for further details.

desc10.pins2: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

desc11.pins2: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc12.pins2: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc13.pins2: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc14.pins2: OC2A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC2A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc15.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc16.pins2: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc17.pins2: OC1C - Output compare matchC output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1C pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc17.pins3: OC0A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc18.pins2: TOSC2 - Timer Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc19.pins2: TOSC1 - Timer Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc20.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

desc23.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc24.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc25.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc25.pins3: SCL - 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.

desc26.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc26.pins3: SDA - 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.

desc27.pins2: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc27.pins3: RXD1 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 1

desc28.pins2: INT3 - External Interrupt source 3 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc28.pins3: TXD1 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 1

desc29.pins2: ICP1 - Timer/Counter1 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter1 description for further details.

desc31.pins2: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc32.pins2: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc33.pins2: /WR - Write strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc34.pins2: /RD - Read strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc35.pins2: A8 - Address bit A8 for XRAM

desc36.pins2: A9 - Address bit A9 for XRAM

desc37.pins2: A10 - Address bit A10 for XRAM

desc38.pins2: A11 - Address bit A11 for XRAM

desc39.pins2: A12 - Address bit A12 for XRAM

desc40.pins2: A13 - Address bit A13 for XRAM

desc41.pins2: A14 - Address bit A14 for XRAM

desc42.pins2: A15 - Address bit A15 for XRAM

desc43.pins2: ALE - Address latch enable for XRAM

desc44.pins2: AD7 - Address/Data bit A7/D7 for XRAM

desc45.pins2: AD6 - Address/Data bit A6/D6 for XRAM

desc46.pins2: AD5 - Address/Data bit A5/D5 for XRAM

desc47.pins2: AD4 - Address/Data bit A4/D4 for XRAM

desc48.pins2: AD3 - Address/Data bit A3/D3 for XRAM

desc49.pins2: AD2 - Address/Data bit A2/D2 for XRAM

desc50.pins2: AD1 - Address/Data bit A1/D1 for XRAM

desc51.pins2: AD0 - Address/Data bit A0/D0 for XRAM

desc54.pins3: TDI - JTAG - Test Data In. Serial input data to be shifted in to the Instruction Register or Data Register (Scan Chains).

desc55.pins3: TDO - JTAG - Test Data Out. Serial output data from Instruction register or Data Register.

desc56.pins3: TMS - JTAG - Test Mode Select. This pin is used for navigating through the TAP-controller.

desc57.pins3: TCK - JTAG - Test Clock. JTAG operation is synchronous to TCK.

desc62.pins1: AREF - Reference voltage for AD converter.

desc64.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.
